meanings.definition: A tool used for engraving or carving
meanings.sent1: The artist used gravers to create intricate designs on the metal.
meanings.sent2: I bought a set of gravers to work on my wood carving project.
meanings.sent3: The gravers in the workshop were always busy, singing as they worked.
meanings.sent4: Her delicate touch with the gravers turned plain stones into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The gleam of the gravers in the sunlight made them look like tiny magic wands.

meanings.definition: A person who engraves or carves
meanings.sent1: The skilled gravers at the jewelry store can personalize any piece.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather was a talented gravers who could etch beautiful designs on glass.
meanings.sent3: The gravers at the fair were showcasing their craft to the amazed crowd.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the fastest gravers in town, finishing projects in record time.
meanings.sent5: The gravers' hands were steady and precise, turning plain surfaces into works of art.

meanings.definition: To engrave or carve with a graver
meanings.sent1: She carefully gravers her initials onto the tree trunk with a sharp tool.
meanings.sent2: The artist gravers intricate patterns onto the clay vase with great skill.
meanings.sent3: He gravers a funny face onto the pumpkin, making it a Halloween masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood gravered into her mind like etchings on stone.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor gravers his emotions into the marble, creating a masterpiece of raw feeling.
